item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Ross Ulbricht granted a full pardon (1363 points | 1438 comments)
2. Show HN: NotepadJs – A cross-platform love letter to Notepad (40 points | 32 comments)
3. Stargate Project: SoftBank, OpenAI, Oracle, MGX to build data centers (752 points | 900 comments)
4. Open Socrates by Agnes Callard review – a design for life (6 points | 1 comment)
5. The Ribbon Microphone (50 points | 13 comments)
6. 0-click deanonymization attack targeting Signal, Discord, other platforms (1298 points | 400 comments)
7. Infinigen (185 points | 14 comments)
8. Isolating complexity is the essence of successful abstractions (154 points | 42 comments)
9. Hunyuan3D 2.0 – High-Resolution 3D Assets Generation (250 points | 127 comments)
10. Strac (YC W22) Is Hiring Windows Engineer ( | hide)
11. Tensor Product Attention Is All You Need (101 points | 68 comments)
12. Vpternlog: When three is 100% more than two (10 points | discuss)
13. Invisible Electrostatic Wall at 3M plant (1996) (358 points | 187 comments)
14. Flame: A small language model for spreadsheet formulas (2023) (57 points | 4 comments)
15. Calm tech certification "rewards" less distracting tech (306 points | 91 comments)
16. 2,100-year-old Alexander the Great mosaic analyzed for restoration (18 points | 4 comments)
17. Why is zero plural? (2024) (84 points | 136 comments)
18. Life in Another Light, 2024 Infrared-Photography-Contest Winners (28 points | 8 comments)
19. Icelandic turf houses: Laufas, Glaumbaer and others (30 points | 14 comments)
20. Dissecting "Tiny Clouds" shadertoy (2017) (76 points | 2 comments)
21. Mercator: Extreme (176 points | 42 comments)
22. The testing pyramid is an outdated economic model (47 points | 32 comments)
23. Castle Game Engine: Web target – big progress, first 3 demos to try (92 points | 18 comments)
24. What are these bumps on the top of a pull-tab can? (215 points | 32 comments)
25. JReleaser: quick and effortless way to release your project (106 points | 26 comments)
26. Prime numbers so memorable that people hunt for them (154 points | 79 comments)
27. Open-source browser port of Pitfall from the Atari 2600 (74 points | 20 comments)
28. The first release of OpenVox, the OSS implementation of Puppet (49 points | 23 comments)
29. Ask HN: Is anyone doing anything cool with tiny language models? (469 points | 233 comments)
30. UK tax collector's phone service deliberately bad to push users online, say MPs (3 points | discuss)
